titlestmt.titleproper: West Philadelphia Medical Book Club records 1870-1976
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

did.unittitle: West Philadelphia Medical Book Club records

bioghist.p: The West Philadelphia Medical Book Club was founded in 1870 to provide books and journals to its members. It was open to members of the medical profession who resided in West Philadelphia.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of records of the West Philadelphia Medical Book Club and Library Association. Materials include: minutes (1870-1939); membership lists and records of dues payments; circulation lists; lists of journals received; financial materials, including an account ledger and bills and receipts; histories, by-laws, and the club's 1874 charter; and several addresses, invitations, and menus. The collection also includes a bound volume of the Philadelphia Almshouse Library's catalog.

accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is restricted; please contact the holding institution for details.
